name: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation
mission: PROVIDE SHELTER,CLOTHING,FOOD TO POOR AND THE NEEDY PEOPLE AROUND THE WORLD.
theoryOfChange: The website describes service delivery aimed at easing suffering through healthcare, education, and social welfare; examples include providing free treatment for those who cannot afford it, operating schools to break barriers to education, and welfare centers extending services to people at their door-steps.
zakatClaimEvidence: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc. is listed as "Zakat eligible". Their donation page explicitly offers a "Zakat" donation option. A PayPal donation page also states, "Use this donation for Zakat Sadaqah Donation". Furthermore, their website features a dedicated "Zakat" section and mentions "Edhi Foundation's Ramadan Zakat Appeal". (Source: https://edhi.org/albaraka-bank-pakistan-ltd/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: UNKNOWN (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 38/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

A PayPal donation page also states, "Use this donation for Zakat Sadaqah Donation". Furthermore, their website features a dedicated "Zakat" section and mentions "Edhi Foundation's Ramadan Zakat Appeal". (Source: https://edhi.org/albaraka-bank-pakistan-ltd/)

all_citations.claim: The organization provides donation options and is recognized as a Zakat-eligible entity for donors.
The foundation reported total revenue of $5,752,945 and maintains a program expense ratio of 95.1%.
The organization holds 120.5 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a solid score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with religious giving requirements, though impact transparency remains at a medium level.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public documentation regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics for impact evaluation
Reliance on medium data confidence levels for third-party verification of program outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a Zakat-eligible entity, the foundation offers a high degree of fit for Muslim donors seeking to fulfill religious obligations through established humanitarian channels [1]. The organization's long-standing track record in providing essential services to the poor aligns with high-priority cultural and religious philanthropic goals [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct service model through its High Ways Project and ambulance services, allocating 95.1% of its $5,752,945 revenue directly to programs [2][3]. While the financial health is exceptionally strong with 120.5 months of working capital, specific evidence of cost-effectiveness per beneficiary is not publicly detailed [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Abdul Sattar Edhi International Foundation Inc provides critical humanitarian relief through a highly efficient financial model dedicated to serving the global poor.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.1%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
Extensive working capital of 120.5 months providing long-term operational stability
baseline_narrative.summary: The organization focuses on providing essential shelter, clothing, and food to needy populations worldwide while maintaining a robust ambulance service and educational programs [2][3]. With a total revenue of $5,752,945, the foundation operates with a high degree of fiscal discipline to support its international mission [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a solid score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and strong alignment with religious giving requirements, though impact transparency remains at a medium level.

Founded in <cite id="2">1949</cite>, the organization has a long history of serving vulnerable communities, particularly in <cite id="3">Pakistan</cite>.
